remarks: Any number ` K ` whose mod base ` N ` is divisible by a divisor ` P ` of the base is also divisible by ` P ` .  This means that primes will also be relatively prime to the base when reduced ` mod N ` for any base. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Mar-2014.)
statement: dvdsmod $p |- ( ( ( P e. NN /\ N e. NN /\ K e. ZZ ) /\ P || N ) -> ( P || ( K mod N ) <-> P || K ) ) $.
